bug.author: lemonad
bug.summary: Traceback when running mnist example (using plaidml/keras)
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.15 Python version: 3.7.4 Keras version: 2.2.4 Plaidml version: 0.6.4 Operating System: Darwin
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I'm trying to run the example at <denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/library/example-projects/keras>https://docs.wandb.com/library/example-projects/keras</denchmark-link> with the addition of <denchmark-code>import os
import plaidml.keras
os.environ["KERAS_BACKEND"] = "plaidml.keras.backend" </denchmark-code>
before the example code (I need it to use Radeon VII on OSX). <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
Running the code, I get a traceback <denchmark-code>Using plaidml.keras.backend backend. wandb: Tracking run with wandb version 0.8.15 wandb: Run data is saved locally in wandb/run-20191113_204208-mg5eih6v wandb: Syncing run gallant-jazz-1 wandb: ‚≠êÔ∏è View project at https://app.wandb.ai/lemonad/uncategorized wandb: üöÄ View run at https://app.wandb.ai/lemonad/uncategorized/runs/mg5eih6v wandb: Run `wandb off` to turn off syncing.
INFO:plaidml:Opening device "metal_amd_radeon_vii.0" Train on 60000 samples, validate on 10000 samples Epoch 1/25 32/60000 [..............................] - ETA: 24:04 - loss: 2.3314 - acc: 0.0312Traceback (most recent call last): File "try_wandb.py", line 67, in <module> callbacks=[WandbCallback(data_type="image", labels=labels)]) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/keras/engine/training.py", line 1039, in fit validation_steps=validation_steps) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/keras/engine/training_arrays.py", line 204, in fit_loop callbacks.on_batch_end(batch_index, batch_logs) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/keras/callbacks.py", line 115, in on_batch_end callback.on_batch_end(batch, logs) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/keras/__init__.py", line 310, in on_batch_end wandb.run.summary['graph'] = wandb.Graph.from_keras(self.model) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/data_types.py", line 961, in from_keras inbound_keras_node = Node.from_keras(in_layer) File "/Users/lemonad/.local/share/virtualenvs/Deep_Learning_HT19-O0LExEKV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/data_types.py", line 1128, in from_keras node.id = layer.name AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'name' </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.77. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Carey Phelps commented: [~accountid:5a99b20982ad632a778cdc6e] could you please take a look at this [https://github.com/<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/issues/676>/issues/676</denchmark-link> |https://github.com/<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client/issues/676>/issues/676</denchmark-link> |smart-link]

I've previously run into other backend/computational graph problems using PlaidML, not related to wandb, so I would not be surprised if this is a problem based in the PlaidML backend differing from e.g. how the tensorflow backend works.

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lemonad>@lemonad</denchmark-link>
In the past year we've majorly reworked the CLI and UI for Weights & Biases. We're closing issues older than 6 months. Please comment to reopen.
